name: TheAtlantic
text:
A mental health crisis is looming as the American West burns.

Many wildfire survivors told @jdkstern13 they felt "haunted" and "disturbed" by the recurring fires. "As irrational as they knew it was, they felt as though the fires were stalking them." https://t.co/61G8mlPSbC

name: TheAtlantic
text: It's common for people in middle age to feel spiritual stirrings, even if they've been nonreligious for some time. @arthurbrooks writes that this change in identity can be scary—but with faith or anything else, it's healthy to let ourselves change: https://t.co/qgge11vMWd

name: TheAtlantic
text: "There were signs that this agreement was coming, and that the Trump administration would be uniquely suited to making it happen," @gcaw writes: https://t.co/4mar4mEKeZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Rather than a moderating presence in the White House, Jared Kushner has often served as Trump's most dangerous enabler. "It’s a role that he thrives at playing, because he’s spent his whole life rehearsing for it," @FranklinFoer writes. https://t.co/vCwd5SYw0D

name: TheAtlantic
text: Through the transformation of religious sites, India’s and Turkey’s leaders are recasting once-secular republics into fully fledged ethnonationalist states, writes @YasmeenSerhan: https://t.co/uo9OnX95wX
